author: Shinichi Saoshiro
title: Dollar edges up on better risk appetite, upbeat U.S. data
text:
NEW YORK (Reuters) - The dollar remained slightly higher against a basket currencies on Wednesday as the Federal Reserveâ€™s Beige Book showed the U.S. economy continued to expand at a modest to moderate pace in March and early April.
FILE PHOTO: The employee of a currency exchange shop shows U.S. dollar banknotes after counting them, in Ciudad Juarez, Mexico November 10, 2017. REUTERS/Jose Luis Gonzalez At 2:04 p.m. (1804 GMT), an index that tracks the greenback versus euro, yen, sterling and three other currencies was up 0.10 percent at 89.602.
Reporting by Richard Leong; Editing by Chizu Nomiyama
